body:
@bluebill1049 , Sorry about that.  I've added a codeSandbox link and a bit more context.  It appears this only happens when you are using watch to watch the value of the field.

Also would it be possible to update the codeSandbox templates in the issue template to use V7?  Currently the samples use v6.

rename.from: V7: formState.isDirty is not set to true onChange
rename.to: V7: formState.isDirty is not set to true onChange if value is watched

body: I see the problem you are missing `defaultValues`, for hook form to check dirty state, we are compare with `defaultValues`.

I don't think that is the problem.

The codeSandbox I shared in fact does set defaultValues.

If I remove the watch command it works correctly, however if I am watching the filed then isDirty is not set until the input is blured. https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-rpm8c?file=/src/index.js
thank you, that's a valid bug.

issue.title: v7: dirtyFields not updating on first input change

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to migrate v6 to v7, when using controlled fields dirtyFields do not updating on first input change.

**To Reproduce**
Just start type one character into MUI Textfield.
Watch the changes on dirtyFields.
Second type will be effect dirtyFields.

**Codesandbox link (Required)**
I have just added dirtyFileds code to show changes.
https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-v7-controller-forked-1vckf?file=/src/index.js:1322-1327

**Expected behavior**
dirtyFields must be updated on first change.

Best regards.

body:
Has a fix for this been included in latest version?

I'm suffering from this same issue using 7.28.0.

I have an onChange handler on an input and changes to the input do not affect the Dirty state until blur unless I remove the onChange handler.
@tombburnell, works fine in the latest version: see [this CSB](https://codesandbox.io/s/late-violet-zz55ub?file=/src/App.tsx)

> > @tombburnell, works fine in the latest version: see [this CSB](https://codesandbox.io/s/late-violet-zz55ub?file=/src/App.tsx) > > Hi, Your example doesn't contain an onChange() handler on the input field. If you add one like below, then the isDirty flag is not updated until the focus changes away from the edited field. regards, Tom > > function titleChange(e: any) { console.log("Title changed", e.target?.value); } > > return ( > > ``` >
> > 
>       First Name: {firstName || "''"}
>
> >
> > ``` > > ); By spreading all the `register` props to your input via `{...register("field")}` and passing your `onChange` handler after, you're re-assigning the input's `onChange` which is used by RHF. Please, assign your `onChange` handler as a second options argument to `register` instead. ```diff ```

> 

Ahha - right, it works now.  Thank you.

I have another similar issue - I have a field 'xxx' that is populated programatically a bit like the following.. where I use setValue() to update a field - this is also not causing the isDirtyFlag to update. Is there a way around this?

<input type="text" {...register('xxx')} />
<button onClick={() => setValue("xxx", "test")}>press me</button>

Also, similarly, I have a file input that I am not currently register on and just using setValue after uploading the image and resizing it... this also does not cause the isDirty to update. I tried to use register() and place the onChange inside it, but it caused the value of the input to become { 0: {} } and I'm not sure I understand why.

 <input
        type="file"
        onChange={(e) => { handleImageUpload(e, (imageUrl) =>  setValue("image_url", imageUrl))}}
    />

Any tips appreciated. Thanks
